conversation.content: [bitter] They want me to stand right there. Um, right where Marcus sat, you know? [pause] And I should be—honestly, I should be happy about this promotion, right? Like, Mom keeps saying it's such an honor, and the pay is better, and... [short pause] God, I mean, Judge Harrison actually shook my hand today. [sarcastic] The same hand that banged the gavel when they gave Marcus fifteen years. [angry] Fifteen years for something he didn't even—[frustrated] sorry, I just... [sigh] The thing is, uh, everyone expects me to be grateful. And part of me, like—[confused] part of me actually is? Which makes me feel so... [trailing off] I don't know. It's basically this twisted joke, you know? [very quietly] Me in uniform, keeping order in the place that destroyed him. [pause] But here's the thing—maybe, I mean, maybe if I'm there, right? If I'm watching, then... [hesitantly] then at least someone who knows the truth is in that room. Someone who, um, who remembers what really happened.
